alert.note: Alert for Far Northeast Highlands; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 7:09PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN UNION AND NORTHEASTERN COLFAX COUNTIES THROUGH 800 PM MDT... At 708 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Branson to 11 miles west of Capulin to near Maxwell. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Des Moines, Folsom, Raton Crews Airport and Capulin. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 427 and 445. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 333 and 340, and between Mile Markers 355 and 388. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area. Accumulations of small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.

area.areaDesc: Far Northeast Highlands; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass
